# Checklist: Hearing or Trial Preparation

<!-- This checklist ensures comprehensive preparation for hearings and trials -->

## Purpose

To systematically prepare for court hearings and trials, ensuring all necessary steps are completed and nothing is overlooked.

## When to Use

- For any court hearing (interim or final)
- For case management conferences
- For applications
- For trial preparation
- Use timeline: begin 4-6 weeks before hearing

---

## Section 1: Initial Preparation (4-6 Weeks Before)

### Hearing Details Confirmed

- [ ] **Hearing date:** ___________
- [ ] **Time:** ___________
- [ ] **Court/location:** ___________
- [ ] **Courtroom:** ___________
- [ ] **Judge:** ___________
- [ ] **Hearing type:** [ ] CMC [ ] Application [ ] PTR [ ] Trial [ ] Other: ___________
- [ ] **Time estimate:** ___________ hours/days
- [ ] **In person/remote:** ___________

### Court Directions Review

- [ ] **Directions order** reviewed
- [ ] **All directed steps** completed
- [ ] **Outstanding compliance** issues identified
- [ ] **Any variations** needed identified

### Team and Representation

- [ ] **Counsel instructed:** [ ] Yes [ ] No
  - Name: ___________
  - Instructed date: ___________
  - Brief delivered date: ___________

- [ ] **Solicitor attending:** ___________
- [ ] **Client attending:** [ ] Yes [ ] No [ ] TBC
- [ ] **Witnesses attending:** (list) ___________

### Initial Case Review

- [ ] **File reviewed** comprehensively
- [ ] **Pleadings** reviewed
- [ ] **Evidence** reviewed
- [ ] **Key issues** identified
- [ ] **Weaknesses** assessed
- [ ] **Settlement prospects** considered

---

## Section 2: Documents and Bundles (3-4 Weeks Before)

### Trial/Hearing Bundle

- [ ] **Court directions** on bundle reviewed
- [ ] **Bundle contents** identified per directions
- [ ] **Pagination** system agreed with opponent
- [ ] **Bundle index** drafted
- [ ] **Documents** collated
- [ ] **Chronological order** (or as directed/agreed)

**Standard bundle structure:**
- [ ] Section A: Claim form and statements of case
- [ ] Section B: Orders and case management documents
- [ ] Section C: Witness statements (in logical order)
- [ ] Section D: Experts' reports and joint statements
- [ ] Section E: Correspondence (if relevant)
- [ ] Section F: Other documents (chronological)

**Bundle preparation:**
- [ ] **Documents** numbered continuously
- [ ] **Index** with page references
- [ ] **Dividers** between sections
- [ ] **Legible copies** (consider enlarging if poor quality)
- [ ] **Electronic bundle** if required
- [ ] **Agreed with opponent** where possible

**Filing and service:**
- [ ] **Filed** with court 7 days before (or per directions)
- [ ] **Copies provided** to all parties
- [ ] **Reading list** prepared (if required)
- [ ] **Core bundle** prepared (if large case)

See [Bundling and Pagination Guidance](../../admin/contentious-probate-file/bundling-and-pagination-guidance.md)

### Authorities Bundle

- [ ] **Key authorities** identified
- [ ] **Copies** of cases obtained
- [ ] **Relevant passages** highlighted
- [ ] **Authorities bundle** paginated
- [ ] **Index** of authorities
- [ ] **Filed/served** per timetable

---

## Section 3: Skeleton Arguments (2-3 Weeks Before)

### Preparation

- [ ] **Deadline** for skeleton: ___________
- [ ] **Who drafting:** [ ] Solicitor [ ] Counsel
- [ ] **Draft** reviewed: ___________

### Content

**Skeleton must include:**
- [ ] **Concise summary** of case
- [ ] **Issues** to be determined
- [ ] **Relevant facts** (with bundle references)
- [ ] **Legal submissions** (with authority references)
- [ ] **Relief sought**
- [ ] **Time estimate**

**Quality checks:**
- [ ] **Bundle references** accurate
- [ ] **Authority citations** correct
- [ ] **Concise** (not excessive length)
- [ ] **Clear structure** with headings
- [ ] **Page/paragraph numbers**
- [ ] **Supervisor review** completed

### Filing and Service

- [ ] **Filed** by deadline
- [ ] **Served** on all parties
- [ ] **Copy to client**
- [ ] **Copy to counsel** (if separate)

---

## Section 4: Witness Preparation (2-3 Weeks Before)

### Factual Witnesses

**For each witness:**
- [ ] **Witness contacted** and availability confirmed
- [ ] **Witness summons** issued if necessary
- [ ] **Meeting arranged** for preparation
- [ ] **Statement** reviewed with witness
- [ ] **Documents** reviewed with witness
- [ ] **Cross-examination** likely topics discussed
- [ ] **Court procedure** explained
- [ ] **Witness's questions** answered

**Witness conference notes:**
- [ ] **Detailed note** of conference made
- [ ] **Any changes** to evidence noted
- [ ] **Witness confirmed** understanding

**Practical arrangements:**
- [ ] **Travel arrangements** made
- [ ] **Accommodation** if needed
- [ ] **Expenses** arrangement clarified
- [ ] **Arriving early** arranged
- [ ] **Special measures** if needed (vulnerable witness)

### Expert Witnesses

- [ ] **Expert** availability confirmed
- [ ] **Expert report** reviewed
- [ ] **Joint statement** (if applicable) reviewed
- [ ] **Supplementary questions** answered
- [ ] **Conference** with expert arranged
- [ ] **Expert's fee** for attendance agreed
- [ ] **Travel arrangements** confirmed

---

## Section 5: Legal Preparation (1-2 Weeks Before)

### Case Law Research

- [ ] **Key authorities** identified
- [ ] **Recent cases** searched
- [ ] **Opponent's authorities** reviewed
- [ ] **Distinguishing arguments** prepared
- [ ] **Authorities** provided to court/opponent per timetable

### Legal Issues

- [ ] **Each issue** analyzed
- [ ] **Burden of proof** identified
- [ ] **Standard of proof** clear
- [ ] **Elements to prove** listed
- [ ] **Evidence** mapped to issues
- [ ] **Gaps** in evidence addressed

### Costs

- [ ] **Costs budget** updated
- [ ] **N260** costs statement prepared (if required)
- [ ] **Costs position** for hearing identified
- [ ] **Costs submissions** prepared

---

## Section 6: Strategic Preparation (1 Week Before)

### Settlement Review

- [ ] **Settlement prospects** reassessed
- [ ] **Part 36 offer** considered
- [ ] **Client's position** on settlement confirmed
- [ ] **Opponent's position** assessed
- [ ] **Mediation/ADR** considered (even at late stage)

### Advocacy Plan

- [ ] **Opening submissions** prepared
- [ ] **Key points** identified (top 3-5)
- [ ] **Order of witnesses** planned
- [ ] **Examination-in-chief** notes prepared
- [ ] **Cross-examination** themes identified
- [ ] **Re-examination** anticipated
- [ ] **Closing submissions** drafted

### Contingencies

- [ ] **Alternative outcomes** considered
- [ ] **Fall-back positions** identified
- [ ] **Compromise positions** (if any) agreed with client
- [ ] **Adjournment** grounds (if needed)

---

## Section 7: Client Preparation (1 Week Before)

### Client Conference

- [ ] **Conference** arranged - Date: ___________
- [ ] **Venue:** ___________
- [ ] **Attendees:** ___________

**Agenda:**
- [ ] **Review evidence** and case
- [ ] **Explain procedure** step-by-step
- [ ] **Discuss prospects** realistically
- [ ] **Review costs** position
- [ ] **Settlement** prospects discussed
- [ ] **Client's questions** answered
- [ ] **Practical arrangements** explained

### If Client Giving Evidence

- [ ] **Statement reviewed** with client
- [ ] **Court procedure** explained
- [ ] **Cross-examination** nature explained
- [ ] **Dos and don'ts** discussed
- [ ] **Practice questions** (light touch - not coaching)
- [ ] **What to expect** explained
- [ ] **Dress code** discussed
- [ ] **Demeanor** guidance given

### Client Expectations

- [ ] **Realistic** about prospects
- [ ] **Understands** possible outcomes
- [ ] **Prepared** for adverse outcome
- [ ] **Costs risks** understood
- [ ] **Settlement authority** confirmed

---

## Section 8: Practical Arrangements (Final Week)

### Logistics

- [ ] **Court location** confirmed
- [ ] **Security requirements** checked
- [ ] **Parking** arrangements known
- [ ] **Robing facilities** (if needed)
- [ ] **Conference room** availability

### Travel and Attendance

**Solicitor:**
- [ ] **Travel** arranged
- [ ] **Accommodation** if needed (overnight)
- [ ] **Arriving early** planned (at least 30 mins)

**Counsel:**
- [ ] **Attendance** confirmed
- [ ] **Papers** with counsel
- [ ] **Conference** time arranged (usually morning of)

**Client:**
- [ ] **Travel** arranged or discussed
- [ ] **Support person** if needed
- [ ] **Arriving** time specified

**Witnesses:**
- [ ] **Each witness** travel confirmed
- [ ] **Sequestration** if applicable
- [ ] **Waiting arrangements** explained

### Technology

- [ ] **Remote hearing?** [ ] Yes [ ] No
  - [ ] Platform: ___________
  - [ ] Test connection before
  - [ ] Backup plan
  - [ ] Client familiar with platform

- [ ] **Electronic presentation?**
  - [ ] Equipment available
  - [ ] Documents in electronic format
  - [ ] Tested before hearing

### Materials

- [ ] **Bundles** - sufficient copies:
  - [ ] Judge (1)
  - [ ] Witnesses (as needed)
  - [ ] Solicitor (1)
  - [ ] Counsel (1)
  - [ ] Client (1)
  - [ ] Opponent (confirm received)

- [ ] **Authorities** bundle - copies
- [ ] **Skeleton arguments** - copies
- [ ] **Spare paper** and pens
- [ ] **Laptop/tablet** if using
- [ ] **Business cards**
- [ ] **File with original documents** (if needed)

---

## Section 9: Final Checks (2-3 Days Before)

### Document Review

- [ ] **All bundles** checked for accuracy
- [ ] **Pagination** correct
- [ ] **Index** accurate
- [ ] **Documents legible**
- [ ] **Authorities** up to date

### Evidence Review

- [ ] **All witness statements** re-read
- [ ] **Expert reports** re-read
- [ ] **Inconsistencies** noted
- [ ] **Key passages** marked/noted

### Legal Review

- [ ] **Skeleton** re-read
- [ ] **Authorities** re-read
- [ ] **Key passages** marked
- [ ] **Legal arguments** refreshed

### Procedural Check

- [ ] **All orders** complied with
- [ ] **All documents** filed
- [ ] **All deadlines** met
- [ ] **Nothing outstanding**

---

## Section 10: Day Before Hearing

### Final Preparation

- [ ] **All materials** ready and packed
- [ ] **Travel** arrangements confirmed
- [ ] **Witnesses** confirmed attending
- [ ] **Counsel** confirmed attending
- [ ] **Client** confirmed attending

### Review

- [ ] **Key points** reviewed
- [ ] **Skeleton** re-read
- [ ] **Opening** rehearsed (mentally)
- [ ] **Worst case** scenarios considered

### Contingency

- [ ] **Contact numbers** for all parties
- [ ] **Court contact** number
- [ ] **Plan B** for transport/technology issues
- [ ] **Adjournment grounds** ready (if needed)

---

## Section 11: Morning of Hearing

### Arrival

- [ ] **Arrive early** (30-45 minutes)
- [ ] **Security** cleared
- [ ] **Check** correct courtroom
- [ ] **Notify** court clerk of arrival

### Pre-Hearing

- [ ] **Meet counsel** if attending
- [ ] **Brief conference** if needed
- [ ] **Meet client** and settle them
- [ ] **Check on witnesses**
- [ ] **Speak to opponent's solicitor** (courtesy/logistics)
- [ ] **Check** for any last-minute developments

### Final Checks

- [ ] **All documents** to hand
- [ ] **Mobile phones** off
- [ ] **Client** ready and calm
- [ ] **Witnesses** ready (if testifying that day)

---

## Section 12: During Hearing

### Court Etiquette

- [ ] **Bow** to judge on entry/exit
- [ ] **Stand** when judge enters/leaves
- [ ] **Address** judge correctly (My Lord/Lady, Your Honour)
- [ ] **Speak clearly** and respectfully
- [ ] **Mobile off** throughout

### Notes

- [ ] **Take detailed notes** of proceedings
- [ ] **Judge's questions** noted
- [ ] **Opponent's arguments** noted
- [ ] **Evidence** given noted
- [ ] **Judge's comments** noted carefully

### Flexibility

- [ ] **Adapt** to judge's approach
- [ ] **Time management** if judge indicates
- [ ] **Respond** to judge's concerns
- [ ] **Be ready** to move to different issue if directed

---

## Section 13: Post-Hearing

### Immediate After

- [ ] **Speak to client** and explain outcome
- [ ] **Debrief with counsel** if attending
- [ ] **Thank witnesses**
- [ ] **Expenses** collected/processed
- [ ] **Any immediate orders** complied with

### Within 24 Hours

- [ ] **Detailed file note** of hearing
- [ ] **Client report** sent (written)
- [ ] **Costs** position noted
- [ ] **Next steps** identified
- [ ] **Deadlines** arising from hearing diarized

### Follow-Up

- [ ] **Draft order** prepared (if required)
- [ ] **Agreed with opponent** (if required)
- [ ] **Submitted to court**
- [ ] **Sealed order** obtained
- [ ] **Order** sent to client
- [ ] **Compliance** with order diarized

### Review

- [ ] **Lessons learned** noted
- [ ] **What went well**
- [ ] **What could be improved**
- [ ] **Feedback** to team
- [ ] **Update procedures** if needed

---

## Special Considerations

### For Trials (Additional Items)

- [ ] **Opening note** prepared
- [ ] **Chronology** prepared
- [ ] **Cast list** (dramatis personae)
- [ ] **Trial timetable** prepared
- [ ] **Reading list** prepared
- [ ] **Cross-examination** notes detailed
- [ ] **Closing submissions** prepared
- [ ] **Draft order** prepared

### For Remote Hearings

- [ ] **Technology tested** well in advance
- [ ] **Backup device** available
- [ ] **Stable internet** connection verified
- [ ] **Quiet location** secured
- [ ] **Background** appropriate
- [ ] **Lighting** adequate
- [ ] **Camera** at eye level
- [ ] **Documents** visible on screen
- [ ] **Court platform** familiar

### For Vulnerable Client/Witness

- [ ] **Special measures** application made
- [ ] **Support person** arranged
- [ ] **Breaks** anticipated/arranged
- [ ] **Intermediary** if needed
- [ ] **Separate entrance/waiting** if needed
- [ ] **Screen** or video link if ordered

---
